verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329>, Altaschith<WH516>, Michtam<WH4387> of David<WH1732>; when Saul<WH7586> sent<WH7971>, and they watched<WH8104> the house<WH1004> to kill him<WH4191>. Deliver<WH5337> me from mine enemies<WH341>, O my God<WH430>: defend<WH7682> me from them that rise up<WH6965> against me. Altaschith: or, To the chief Musician, destroy not, a golden Psalm of David defend: Heb. set me on high
Deliver<WH5337> me from the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205>, and save<WH3467> me from bloody<WH1818> men<WH582>.
For, lo, they lie in wait<WH693> for my soul<WH5315>: the mighty<WH5794> are gathered<WH1481> against me; not for my transgression<WH6588>, nor for my sin<WH2403>, O LORD<WH3068>.
They run<WH7323> and prepare<WH3559> themselves without my fault<WH5771>: awake<WH5782> to help<WH7125> me, and behold<WH7200>. help: Heb. meet

Thou therefore, O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, awake<WH6974> to visit<WH6485> all the heathen<WH1471>: be not merciful<WH2603> to any wicked<WH205> transgressors<WH898>. Selah<WH5542>.
They return<WH7725> at evening<WH6153>: they make a noise<WH1993> like a dog<WH3611>, and go round about<WH5437> the city<WH5892>.
Behold, they belch out<WH5042> with their mouth<WH6310>: swords<WH2719> are in their lips<WH8193>: for who, say they, doth hear<WH8085>?
But thou, O LORD<WH3068>, shalt laugh<WH7832> at them; thou shalt have all the heathen<WH1471> in derision<WH3932>.
Because of his strength<WH5797> will I wait<WH8104> upon thee: for God<WH430> is my defence<WH4869>. defence: Heb. high place
The God<WH430> of my mercy<WH2617> shall prevent<WH6923> me: God<WH430> shall let me see<WH7200> my desire upon mine enemies<WH8324>. enemies: Heb. observers
Slay<WH2026> them not, lest my people<WH5971> forget<WH7911>: scatter<WH5128> them by thy power<WH2428>; and bring them down<WH3381>, O Lord<WH136> our shield<WH4043>.

For the sin<WH2403> of their mouth<WH6310> and the words<WH1697> of their lips<WH8193> let them even be taken<WH3920> in their pride<WH1347>: and for cursing<WH423> and lying<WH3585> which they speak<WH5608>.

Consume<WH3615> them in wrath<WH2534>, consume<WH3615> them, that they may not be: and let them know<WH3045> that God<WH430> ruleth<WH4910> in Jacob<WH3290> unto the ends<WH657> of the earth<WH776>. Selah<WH5542>.
And at evening<WH6153> let them return<WH7725>; and let them make a noise<WH1993> like a dog<WH3611>, and go round about<WH5437> the city<WH5892>.

Let them wander up and down<WH5128> <WH5128> for meat<WH398>, and grudge<WH3885> if they be not satisfied<WH7646>. for meat: Heb. to eat and grudge: or, if they be not satisfied, then they will stay all night

But I will sing<WH7891> of thy power<WH5797>; yea, I will sing aloud<WH7442> of thy mercy<WH2617> in the morning<WH1242>: for thou hast been my defence<WH4869> and refuge<WH4498> in the day<WH3117> of my trouble<WH6862>.
Unto thee, O my strength<WH5797>, will I sing<WH2167>: for God<WH430> is my defence<WH4869>, and the God<WH430> of my mercy<WH2617>.
